channel.title: Question regarding the progress of this server
channel.description: Has any progress been made? Do you guys plan on telling us if you quit or not?

item.title: Question regarding the progress of this server
item.dc:creator: @Fate1 Fate.
item.description:
@Fate1 wrote:

Not that it bothers me, the actual case was that I asked you if you’d like to help making content for RSCR 3 months ago…

That’s the only invite you have been given, and you told me that content is irrelevant.

Read full topic

item.title: Question regarding the progress of this server
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

[quote=“n0om, post:16, topic:535597”][quote author=Rodgerwilco link=topic=654403.msg4398212#msg4398212 date=1389757242]

Also, ignore this guy “Ridgerwilco”. His bitterness comes from his own 3 servers coming to a halt after a week or two. He has never made, or been apart of something successful so he doesn’t want to see anyone else. Keep doing what you are doing RSCRevolution.

Just 3 and all have been up over a month
I was invited to be a pard of RSCR but I declined. It’s not that I don’t want to see someone else be successful… as I did personally root for projectrsc and rscangel… it’s just inevitable.
[/quote]
We have never invited you to be part of RSCRevolution.[/quote]

Should I bother posting chat logs? Yes you guys did, multiple times.

item.title: Question regarding the progress of this server
item.dc:creator: @Outspoken Outspoken
item.description:
@Outspoken wrote:

I haven’t checked out RSCRevolution, but it sounds fantastic and I like that there are still people out there that is more interested in the development than the little bit of money that comes from this. So good job and I hope it continues to be successful. If you need help with anything, you can shoot me a PM here.

Also, ignore this guy “Ridgerwilco”. His bitterness comes from his own 2357987 servers coming to a halt after a week or two. He has never made, or been apart of something successful so he doesn’t want to see anyone else. Keep doing what you are doing RSCRevolution.

Read full topic
item.source: Question regarding the progress of this server

item.title: Question regarding the progress of this server
item.dc:creator: @RSCRevolution RSCRevolution
item.description:
@RSCRevolution wrote:

[quote=“Rodgerwilco, post:12, topic:535597”][quote author=lumbisnear link=topic=654403.msg4398135#msg4398135 date=1389740165]
@Rodgerwilco

Why are you saying RSCR has 10 online? It’s being attacked with 19-23 Gbps daily, yet it still peaked at 34 online today and almost always has 15-25 players online between attacks.

Logic indicates that without the attacks the playercount would be even higher.
[/quote]

Well everytime I care to check it has 10 or less maybe it’s just my time zone but I really don’t care. 15-25 and a peak of 34 aint going to cut it. A pk server that’s hosted for a week will get more players and more attention. That’s fact.[/quote]

To be fair we dont try to cut it. All we do is bring to people what they enjoy. The revenue it give or the amount of players we got is only a number. What we care bout is to wake up in the morning and work on this project as we love to do this.

As for the DDOS well… its kind of obvious someone hate all the hard dedication we put into this and that we been able to accomplish all this in a few months while others took years to be half as advanced.

But i understand your point . Its lot of time and dedication for such a small community. Reason we are doing it is because we love this game and this project .

Overall, kind of happy you gave a try. RSC players deserve our effort to bring them what they enjoy playing.

Kudos for at least trying!

Hows your school session by the way?

Read full topic
item.source: Question regarding the progress of this server

item.title: Question regarding the progress of this server
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

Community driven. Community is dead. I have no problem working on it but I am right around the corner of finishing my degree. There just isn’t any demand for it. Look at RSCR (as soon as I personally launched moparclassic they went out of their way to launch their server) with 10 players online. Same thing with ProjectRSC where we announce moparclassic… kryptix dies and people think they can be head man of the community because that opportunity is available. ProjectRSC is now dead.

You can sit here and bash on moparclassic and that’s easy to do but once again it all comes back to being a community driven server. If people want to get together and coordinate this project they are more than welcome to… but it’s the same reasoning that they won’t which is why it’s not publicly hosted.

MoparClassic has been in development for 8 years now. It’s just an updated RSCD and we gave credits when credit was due to everyone who pitched in along the way. The reason we changed the name is because instead of battling it out, ddosing each other, driving away the players it’s time to say fk it and centralize the community with the open source project.

You have 2 people who are more than happy to pay the cost of hosting (MITB and I). I did host the project recently which was great because it gave us a hand full of problems I would of never of been able to test alone and it looks like we fixed a few dupes that were there previously. I threw down the towel since MITB wanted the server to be more centralized and I felt that it was necessary since he obviously meets the requirements and has great success with his projects. Plus he’s not money hungry which eliminates 99% of you guys.

Anyways… say what you want. Bash the server, state the “facts” but in all reality you have 2 solutions… a server that has been economically fked for the past few years and was ran by a money hungry pirate or a server with 10 people online that’s doing it’s best to be closed source and compete. Tbh I would pick a pk server with 100x exp rate and play that for a week before joining either of those.

Read full topic
item.source: Question regarding the progress of this server

item.title: Question regarding the progress of this server
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

[quote=“Iron Maiden, post:8, topic:535597”]any info on this server? haven’t played runescape in like 2 years but was remembering about it yesterday

loged in today see this is still around[/quote]
MoparClassic has been in the making for past 3 years, and is still not being hosted anywhere, nor any notable development progress has been done since start (other than rewriting tons of things in scala and other bullshit who nobody asked for and has no effect in game). Don’t bother wasting time on this, everyone else gave up on it already.

Read full topic

item.title: Question regarding the progress of this server
item.dc:creator: @malikz malikz
item.description:
@malikz wrote:

Rodgerwilco:

Nobody is quitting. Also… you’re more than welcome to contribute.

How can I contribute? If it’s money, I have too many bills right now to dish out even 1 dollar.

I think moparisthebest said he/she is waiting on the client. Don’t think I can do much there. That might be on you guys, the developers.

@n0om, I may consider it. How many people actively play your server?

Read full topic
item.source: Question regarding the progress of this server

item.title: Question regarding the progress of this server
item.dc:creator: @n0om n0om
item.description:
@n0om wrote:

[quote=“malikz, post:3, topic:535597”]Yeah, I did…but most posts are months old.

Curious if I should give up on the rsc community forever. Had loads of fun with one of the massive low rate servers, where we had wars with full mith and a2h’s (I think it was Proj***RSC). Was a ton of fun, and I was looking for another good server to give that same excitement, but I get discouraged when I see it takes years to get a proper working server out.[/quote]
Don’t give up just yet, your prayers has been answered
Take a look at RSCRevolution, it’s been online for 3 months and has F2P replicated, partly replicated P2P(Skills, NPC’s, Drops, 8 quests) and is still being actively developed.

Read full topic
